name: Tito Puente
description:
'''Ernest Anthony''' '''Puente Jr.''' (April 20, 1923 – May 31, 2000), commonly known as '''Tito''' '''Puente''', was a Puerto Rican musician, [[songwriter]], bandleader, [[Timbales|timbalero]], and [[record producer]]. He composed dance-oriented [[mambo (music)|mambo]] and [[Latin jazz]] music. He was also known as “El Rey de los Timbales,” or “The King of the Timbales.”

Puente and his music have appeared in films including ''[[The Mambo Kings]]'' and [[Fernando Trueba]]'s ''[[Calle 54]]''. He guest-starred on television shows, including ''[[Sesame Street]]'' and ''[[The Simpsons]]'' episode "[[Who Shot Mr. Burns?]]".
